thread.title: Kylian Mbappe warned off Manchester United move by Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema
thread.title_full: Kylian Mbappe warned off Manchester United move by Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema

author: jsgoldman
title: Kylian Mbappe warned off Manchester United move by Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema
text:
Mbappe could make his senior France debut against Luxembourg this evening (Picture: Getty) Kylian Mbappe has been warned off a potential summer move to Manchester United by Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema.
Chelsea ready to secure major star's future with new contract Monaco’s teenage striker has shot to prominence this season on the back of an impressive Champions League campaign that has seen the Ligue 1 leaders account for Premier League heavyweights Tottenham and Manchester City.
Mbappe, who is primed to make his senior France debut against Luxembourg this evening, has scored 10 goals in his last seven games in all competitions and has been heavily linked with a summer move to one of Europe’s giants.
Mbappe scored in both legs of Monaco’s Champions League last 16 win over Manchester City (Picture: Getty) Kylian Mbappe has scored 10 goals in his last seven games (Picture: Getty) Benzema, who moved from Lyon to Real Madrid when he was just 21, has warned Mbappe, however, of the pitfalls of transferring abroad at such a young age.
‘I’ve been told he is a phenomenon, a very good player,’ said Benzema.
‘Honestly, I still haven’t seen him. He’s a young player. Football is really hard, especially at big clubs.
Karim Benzema moved from Lyon to Real Madrid at the age of just 21 (Picture: Getty) ‘I arrived at Madrid at 21. I had already done a lot of things at Lyon, but when I got here I got a slap in the face.
‘My first year was too difficult. You’re far from your family, it’s not the same.
‘Those who are next to you are there to take your place. It’s very difficult. But from what people have said, he’s a very good player, and I hope he’ll have a great career, little by little.
More: Football Wayne Rooney slams Neil Taylor over tackle which broke Seamus Coleman's leg 
Inter Milan set astonishing asking price for Manchester United target Ivan Perisic 
Club president responds to £43m Man Utd approach 
‘I think you mustn’t leave too soon. Things go well, but the day when it goes less well, that’s the problem.
‘He’s 18, how do you handle it when it doesn’t go as well, when people don’t speak as well about you, when you’re put under pressure?’
MORE: Real Madrid president Florentino President hints at summer move for Kylian Mbappe – ‘Anything is possible’
